* Title: Information Technology Project Management
* Code: CNTT1159
* Credits: 3 (45)
* Credit hours for teaching and learning activities:
+ Lecture: 25 hrs
+ Exercises on class: 10 hrs
+ Presentation and Discussion: 10 hrs
+ Self-study: 60 hrs
* Parallel course(s):
* Prerequisite course(s): CNTT1116
* Department conducting the course:
+ Faculty: Information Technology; Room 13.10, Building A1, National Economics University; Phone number: 024.36280.280 (6334)
+ Lecturers:
1. PhD. Lê Thị Hoài Thu	Tel: 0912727529	Email: thulh@neu.edu.vn
2. MSc. Trần Thị Mỹ Diệp…Tel: 0904335056	Email: diepttm@neu.edu.vn
* Kind of the course:

Foundation □ | Foundation □ | Fundamental (x) | Fundamental (x)
Compulsory □ | Elective □ | Compulsory | Elective (x)
* Course language: 	In English
* Meeting hours: 8 AM – 11 AM on Wednesdays, Room 13.10, Building A1, National Economics University

The course aims to provide students with basic knowledge of  IT projects, focusing on project management and IT project management. Students will be instructed to learn and practice management skills. Include sections: project goal; project initialization; processes and areas of knowledge needed to successfully manage information technology (IT) projects. The main functions of management are mentioned in this course such as planning, organizing, leading,  controlling, closing, and evaluating IT projects. Tools within software and templates that support IT project management will be introduced in this course to provide effective approaches to managing IT projects.
Course content includes:
- Overview of  IT project management
- Conceptualizing and Initializing the IT Project
- Business Case &Project Charter
- Planning and Estimate IT Project
- Work Break Structure
- Time, cost estimate
- Organizing and Executing IT Project
- Development Team project
- Controlling the progress of  IT Project
- Controlling the quality of  IT Project
- Controlling communication of IT Project
- Controlling the risk of IT Project
- Closing and evaluating IT Project
The course also aims to train thinking skills, the ability to self-study knowledge, and the use of apps to support management projects by working independently as well as in groups. Students will be divided into groups to learn deeply about projects, from which they can show their skills in phases to manage a particular IT project.

* Textbooks/Lecture Notes:
- Le Thi Hoai Thu & et.al (2024) Information Technology Project Management, Nhà xuất bản Đại học Kinh tế quốc dân.
- Kathy Schwalbe (2018) Information Technology Project Management, 9th, Cengage Learning Inc.
* Additional references:
- Management Institute (PMI), 2020, A Guide to the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK Guide).
- Jack T Marchewka, (2003), Information Technology Project Management: provide Measurable Organizational Value, John Wiley & Sons
- Pham Ngoc Hung, Tran Hoang Viet (2022), Giao trình Quan ly du an phan mem, NXB Đại học quốc gia

Table 4. Course goals

G1 | The course provides professional knowledge about IT projects and IT project management. Includes: Project goal, phases, and areas of knowledge needed to manage and IT project management process (as project selection, planning, implementation, control, closing, and evaluation ) | 3-4
G2 | The course guides students to practice skills in managing IT projects such as: Defining goals, Selecting projects, Initiating projects, Developing WBS, Estimating time, and costs), Organizing project implementation teams, Controlling schedule, cost, quality, communication, and risk; | 3U
G3 | The course contributes to developing the ability to work independently and collaboratively, fostering a correct understanding of responsibilities in task execution and professional ethics. | 3

8.3. Requirements for in-class behavior
